item.title: Mary add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "Except for the point, the still point, There would be no dance, and there is only the dance" -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: Mary add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Do I dare Disturb the universe? In a minute there is time For decisions and revisions which a minute will reverse." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Mary add a quote by T.S. Eliot.
Mary add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "The last act is the greatest treason. To do the right deed for the wrong reason." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Mary add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "We shall not cease from exploration And the end of all our exploring Will be to arrive where we started And know the place for the first time." -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: Mary add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Genuine poetry can communicate before it is understood." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Mary add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "What is hell? Hell is oneself. Hell is alone, the other figures in it Merely projections. There is nothing to escape from And nothing to escape to. One is always alone." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Mary add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "This is the way the world ends Not with a bang but a whimper." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Mary add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description:
"I have heard the mermaids singing, each to each.
I do not think that they will sing to me." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Mary add a quote by Eddie Izzard
item.description: "This is your captain speaking. Welcome aboard flight...one, from...here to there. We'll be cruising at a height of ten feet, going up to twelve and a half feet if we see anything big. And our copilot today is a flask of coffee." -- Eddie Izzard

item.title: Mary add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "To be sure you know no actual good of me, but nobody thinks of that when they fall in love." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Mary add a quote by Northern Exposure- The Big Kiss
item.description: "We all carry around so much pain in our hearts. Love and pain and beauty. They all seem to go together like one little tody confusing package. It's a messy business, life. It's hard to figure- full of surprises. Some good. Some bad. " -- Northern Exposure- The Big Kiss

item.title: Mary add a quote by Adam Savage
item.description: "I reject your reality and substitute my own." -- Adam Savage

item.title: Mary add a quote by Ursula Vernon
item.description: "I love boats. Boats are great. You can get all kinds of places and meet all kinds of interesting people, and you never know if they're going to try to eat you or worship you." -- Ursula Vernon

item.title: Mary add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "And I will show you something different from either Your shadow at morning striding behind you Or your shadow at evening rising to meet you I will show you fear in a handful of dust" -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Mary add a quote by Martha Graham
item.description: "Dance is the hidden language of the soul" -- Martha Graham

item.title: Mary add a quote by Martha Graham
item.description: "Dancers are the messengers of the gods." -- Martha Graham

item.title: Mary add a quote by Martha Graham
item.description: "Nobody cares if you can't dance well. Just get up and dance. Great dancers are great because of their passion." -- Martha Graham

item.title: Mary add a quote by Martha Graham
item.description: "There is a fatigue so great that the body cries, even in its sleep. There are times of complete frustration; there are daily small deaths." -- Martha Graham

item.title: Mary add a quote by Charles Haddon Spurgeon
item.description: "By perseverance, the snail reached the ark." -- Charles Haddon Spurgeon

item.title: Mary add a quote by Ursula Vernon
item.description: "...and that's how Snuggles the hamster learned that yes, things COULD always get worse. " -- Ursula Vernon

item.title: Mary add a quote by Marcus Aurelius Antoninus
item.description: "Look well into thyself; there is a source of strength which will always spring up if thou wilt always look there." -- Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

item.title: Mary add a quote by Ursula Vernon
item.description: "Trolls have a longstanding animosity for goats--"Who's that trip-tapping across my bridge!?"--and this led me to think that perhaps trolls are related to goats, since it seems a lot more plausible to me that your relatives would make you insane than some random hooved mammal, however ecologically destructive it might be. What if trolls evolved from goats? Or, no, better yet, what if goats evolved from trolls? Or were domesticated from trolls by human shepherds? And the trolls despise their domesticated cousins as a disgrace to the once-proud troll race, (much as I assume wolves would despise Chihuahuas if they ever gave them much thought) and eat them at every opportunity." -- Ursula Vernon

item.title: Mary add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description:
"I have only made this letter longer because I have not had the time to make it shorter."
(<i>Letter 16</i>, 1657)" -- Blaise Pascal
